title: When I Was Little
blurb: A short narrative that uses AR and VR to illustrate differences in perspective and encourage people to communicate.

team.name: Alex Coulombe
team.about: I came into the hackathon knowing I wanted to do something with a multiuser AR/VR experience where the AR viewer sees a god's eye view that includes the VR player. I also thought it would be delightful to get to play with Depthkit. All of this happened-- thanks team!

content_html:
When I Was Little is a shared memory from two different perspectives. Our narrator recalls an emotionally charged childhood memory — as they recount the story, two players experience it simultaneously. One player views the memory unfold in first-person virtual reality. The other player watches the story transpire in third-person, birds-eye-view augmented reality.

The multiplayer experience mirrors the difference between the field and observer perspectives in an autobiographical memory. Sometimes, we remember episodes as seen through our own eyes — other times, it's as if we're watching the events from afar.

It is a double screen with VR/AR graphics.
